description: MLCube Analytics is a companion tool for benchmarking ML model performance across environments using the MLCube packaging standard. It provides visual analytics, leaderboard views, and reproducibility scoring for collaborative ML competitions.

name: Clearbit Analytics
description: Clearbit Analytics enriches web and customer data to provide actionable insights on user behavior, firmographics, and lead scoring. It integrates with CRM and marketing tools, offering visual reports and segmentation for go-to-market teams.

name: Quickwit
description: Quickwit is a search engine optimized for observability and analytics over log data. It indexes log files in object storage with blazing-fast search and supports SQL-based querying for operational metrics and debugging workflows.

name: OpenReplay
description: OpenReplay is a session replay and analytics platform for web apps. It captures everything from user clicks to console logs and network activity, providing insights into user journeys and frontend issues.

name: Flipside Crypto
description: Flipside Crypto is a Web3 analytics platform that provides SQL-based querying and dashboards over blockchain data. It helps analysts explore DeFi, NFT, and on-chain activity with community-driven datasets and charts.

name: Plausible
description: Plausible is a lightweight, privacy-friendly web analytics tool. It provides clean and simple dashboards, avoids cookies, and complies with GDPR — making it a popular alternative to Google Analytics for developers and indie creators.

name: BentoML Analytics
description: BentoML Analytics is a plugin for tracking model inference metrics, latency, and resource usage across ML deployments. It works with BentoML services and helps teams observe model performance in production environments.

name: PyOD
description: PyOD is a comprehensive Python toolkit for detecting outliers in multivariate data. It supports multiple detection algorithms and visual analytics, and is widely used for fraud detection, data cleaning, and anomaly analytics.

name: Goku API Analytics
description: Goku is a powerful gateway with built-in API analytics, rate limiting, and traffic monitoring. It provides real-time dashboards for API consumers and system admins to track usage patterns and ensure SLAs.

name: QueryFlow
description: QueryFlow is a query observability tool that captures, profiles, and analyzes SQL queries in real time. It integrates with Postgres and MySQL, enabling teams to find slow queries, analyze patterns, and optimize database usage with precision.

name: PowerBI React SDK
description: PowerBI React SDK allows developers to embed Microsoft Power BI dashboards and reports into React applications. It supports authentication, customization, and filtering to provide interactive analytics within modern web UIs.

name: DataCater
description: DataCater is a real-time data ingestion and transformation platform focused on streaming analytics. It enables teams to define transformation logic visually or in Python, delivering clean data into downstream systems like Kafka, PostgreSQL, or Elasticsearch with low latency.

name: Graphsignal
description: Graphsignal is an observability platform for AI applications, offering telemetry and performance analytics for Python, LLMs, and ML APIs. It tracks latency, cost, inputs/outputs, and error rates, providing actionable visibility into production AI systems.

name: SQLMesh
description: SQLMesh is a data transformation and analytics framework that enables CI/CD for SQL. It provides environment isolation, semantic diffs, and fast incremental model execution — helping analytics engineers manage versioned, testable data pipelines efficiently.

name: Mojo
description: Mojo is a next-generation programming language optimized for AI and analytics workloads. It combines the usability of Python with the performance of C, enabling faster data pipelines, vector operations, and compiler-level analytics instrumentation.

name: EventNative
description: EventNative is a real-time event collection and routing platform that supports analytics ingestion for data lakes and warehouses. It provides event transformation, deduplication, and schema enforcement — often used to power clickstream and behavioral analytics stacks.

name: Retool Analytics SDK
description: Retool Analytics SDK is an internal analytics tool for tracking usage, API calls, and performance in apps built with Retool. It supports event tracking, custom metrics, and audit trails — ideal for teams needing insight into internal app effectiveness.

name: Snowflake Notebooks
description: Snowflake Notebooks is an interactive analytics IDE within the Snowflake Data Cloud that lets analysts mix SQL, Python, and markdown in a single interface. It enhances exploration, visualization, and collaboration directly on Snowflake-hosted data.

name: InsightDB
description: InsightDB is an analytics-optimized database that precomputes insights and trends over large datasets. It focuses on low-latency access to derived metrics and supports AI-enhanced summarization of KPIs for dashboard applications.

name: MindsDB
description: MindsDB is a predictive analytics layer for databases that enables users to run machine learning models via SQL. It supports integration with MySQL, Postgres, and MongoDB, allowing forecasting and classification directly within the database engine.

name: Tinybird
description: Tinybird is a platform for building real-time APIs from analytical queries. It ingests and processes data streams using SQL and provides ultra-low-latency endpoints for dashboards, monitoring tools, or customer-facing analytics features.

name: Cluvio
description: Cluvio is a cloud-based analytics platform that allows teams to write SQL queries and visualize the results through dashboards. It integrates with PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift, and other databases, and supports scheduling and embedded analytics.

name: Cortex Metrics
description: Cortex is an open-source horizontally scalable Prometheus-compatible monitoring system. It aggregates time-series metrics and supports multi-tenancy, long-term storage, and analytics queries for infrastructure observability.

name: Panther
description: Panther is an open-source security analytics platform that enables detection and monitoring using SQL-based rules over cloud logs. It includes dashboards, alerting pipelines, and compliance checks for teams focused on threat analytics.

name: Matano
description: Matano is an open-source serverless platform for real-time log analytics and detection. Built on Apache Iceberg and Rust, it allows scalable ingestion, querying, and alerting on security-related events and analytics pipelines.

name: Fugue
description: Fugue is a unified framework for distributed computing that enables users to write Python or SQL analytics pipelines that execute on Spark, Dask, or Ray. It abstracts away cluster specifics while supporting advanced transformation logic.

name: Helix
description: Helix is a collaborative data exploration and analytics platform for teams. It provides live dashboards, collaborative SQL editing, data lineage tracking, and governance features — aimed at empowering teams to analyze and share insights quickly.

name: ShinyApps.io
description: ShinyApps.io is a platform for deploying and sharing interactive R analytics dashboards built with Shiny. It enables publishing of data-driven applications with user controls, real-time inputs, and reactive visualizations for statistical analytics.

name: auto-sklearn
description: auto-sklearn is an open-source AutoML library built on top of scikit-learn. It automates model selection, hyperparameter tuning, and ensembling while offering detailed model performance analytics across classification and regression tasks.

name: Gretel Synthetics
description: Gretel Synthetics is a Python library for generating synthetic data using machine learning models. It includes metrics and visual analytics tools to evaluate data privacy, utility, and model drift — often used for secure data sharing and testing.

name: DataSentinel
description: DataSentinel is a data governance and privacy analytics platform that monitors sensitive data access, classifies information assets, and ensures regulatory compliance. It helps enterprises track data exposure and usage patterns at scale.

name: MLTE Dashboard
description: MLTE Dashboard is a visualization layer built on top of the ML Test Engine (MLTE). It provides intuitive dashboards to explore test coverage, data quality, and operational health of ML systems — making evaluation results more accessible for analytics teams.

name: Superset Data Quality Plugin
description: This plugin adds data quality indicators and metrics validation into Apache Superset dashboards. It highlights null rates, schema changes, and threshold-based alerts, offering inline analytics feedback inside BI visualizations.

name: YData Profiling
description: YData Profiling (formerly Pandas Profiling) is a robust Python EDA tool that generates full profiling reports from dataframes. It includes data distributions, missing value heatmaps, correlations, and warnings — streamlining early analytics workflows.

name: DataCurve
description: DataCurve is a platform for A/B testing and experimentation analytics. It offers statistical significance testing, cohort segmentation, and visual reports on experiment outcomes — helping teams drive product decisions through controlled trials.

name: TapTool
description: TapTool is a modern log and metrics analytics tool designed for observability across microservices. It supports structured query interfaces, live tailing, and customizable visualizations for logs, metrics, and traces in distributed systems.

name: Dune
description: Dune is a blockchain analytics platform that allows analysts to write SQL queries over on-chain data. It enables dashboards, alerts, and token activity tracking — powering community-driven insights and DeFi project analytics.

name: Tensorlake
description: Tensorlake is a vector analytics engine that indexes embeddings and unstructured data for similarity search, clustering, and usage analytics. It supports applications involving image, video, and text analytics pipelines at scale.

name: SvelteKit Analytics
description: SvelteKit Analytics is a lightweight plugin for integrating pageviews, event tracking, and user sessions into apps built with SvelteKit. It offers privacy-friendly analytics, self-hosting, and extensible APIs for modern frontend teams.

name: FastSQL
description: FastSQL is a low-latency SQL engine designed for querying columnar datasets in real time. It supports pushdown filters, vectorized execution, and memory-efficient analytics for applications such as dashboard backends and analytics APIs.

name: OctoInsight
description: OctoInsight is a visual analytics engine designed for cybersecurity teams. It maps behavior patterns, anomalies, and threat vectors using interactive graph views and timelines — ideal for breach investigation and incident analysis.

name: Streamdal
description: Streamdal is a real-time observability layer for streaming data pipelines. It captures metadata, schema changes, throughput, and anomaly events for streams across Kafka, Pulsar, and NATS — helping data teams maintain integrity and visibility at scale.

name: Rye Insights
description: Rye Insights is a product analytics tool tailored for small teams. It offers clean, GDPR-compliant dashboards for user behavior, funnel analysis, and retention without cookies or user fingerprinting — designed for ethical, fast-deployable insights.

name: Hopara
description: Hopara is a Python-based visual data analytics library for creating spatial dashboards and workflows. It supports multi-panel exploration of maps, plots, and tabular data, with real-time interactivity and low-code deployment.

name: InsightDB UI
description: InsightDB UI is the frontend dashboarding interface for InsightDB, a metrics-first database. It allows visual exploration of KPIs, trends, and data summaries derived from precomputed queries, tailored for operations and executive analytics.

name: Candlestick
description: Candlestick is an open-source charting library optimized for financial analytics. It supports OHLC charts, trade overlays, volume comparisons, and intraday plotting — ideal for backtesting tools, stock dashboards, or cryptocurrency analysis.

name: Swirl
description: Swirl is an AI-powered search and analytics platform for enterprise data. It unifies search across files, databases, and APIs and adds semantic understanding — enabling enterprise teams to find, analyze, and summarize internal knowledge efficiently.

name: Cubos
description: Cubos is a framework for embedded analytics in SaaS applications. It enables developers to define reusable metrics, build multi-tenant dashboards, and configure data access permissions, all while integrating with existing SQL engines.

name: VQL (Velociraptor Query Language)
description: VQL is a query language designed for cybersecurity analytics in Velociraptor. It supports structured hunting, forensic exploration, and endpoint telemetry analysis with low overhead, making it suitable for threat intelligence dashboards.

name: FactBranch
description: FactBranch is a lightweight analytics and lookup tool that shows data insights in CRM and support platforms like Intercom or Zendesk. It fetches user data from APIs and databases, presenting it in-line for agents and sales teams to act quickly.

name: Deepchecks
description: Deepchecks is a testing and analytics suite for machine learning validation. It offers suites for data integrity, model behavior, performance drift, and fairness — turning quality checks into structured reports for production readiness.

name: DataHub UI
description: DataHub UI is the frontend for the DataHub metadata platform, enabling rich visual exploration of datasets, pipelines, schemas, and usage metrics. It supports data lineage, ownership, search, and analytics around data discovery and governance.

name: Frictionless
description: Frictionless is a data quality and validation toolkit for tabular data. It enables dataset profiling, schema generation, and pipeline validation with integrations for Python, JavaScript, and command-line workflows — perfect for data onboarding analytics.

name: AnalyticFlow
description: AnalyticFlow is a low-code analytics platform for exploring, transforming, and modeling data through flowcharts. It helps analysts visually connect data blocks and logic without code, supporting prototyping and reporting pipelines.

name: Datapane
description: Datapane is an open-source reporting framework for Python. It turns Jupyter notebooks or scripts into interactive HTML reports with plots, tables, and markdown — ideal for sharing analytics with stakeholders without exposing raw code.

name: DuckTM
description: DuckTM is a lightweight analytics engine focused on embedded telemetry in Python applications. It tracks execution time, memory usage, call frequency, and logs aggregated metrics — ideal for profiling analytics-heavy functions and routines.

name: MetricSQL
description: MetricSQL is a query language designed for high-performance metrics analytics. Built on top of VictoriaMetrics, it allows users to aggregate, compare, and visualize metric time series with low-latency — especially useful for infrastructure analytics.

name: Krawler
description: Krawler is a data crawling and analytics toolkit that automates data collection from web pages, APIs, and files. It supports scheduling, deduplication, and transformation — making it a powerful backend for analytics ETL workflows.

name: Reportr
description: Reportr is an open-source dashboard framework for real-time personal analytics. It supports tracking and visualizing user behavior, location, app usage, and external service data via integrations, ideal for quantified-self applications.

name: MLflow Export Import
description: MLflow Export Import is a utility library for exporting MLflow experiments, runs, and models between tracking servers. It includes migration analytics, dependency tracking, and model lineage — useful for multi-environment ML analytics.

name: Trino
description: Trino is a high-performance distributed SQL query engine for analytics over large datasets. Formerly known as PrestoSQL, it enables federated querying across Hive, Iceberg, Kafka, MySQL, and others — powering interactive dashboards and data lakes.
